tool.name: ExecuteReviewerBatchJobOnEdits
tool.displayname: Execute Reviewer Batch Job on R&H Edits

param.name: job__started_date
param.displayname: Edits Start Date (i.e. WMX Job Creation Date)

param.name: job__owned_by
param.displayname: Editor Username (i.e. WMX Owned by User)

tool.summary: Runs a Data Reviewer Batch Job (.rbj) file against a version of an enterprise geodatabase. Input parameters determine the date from which edits should be examined and the username of the editor whose edits should be examined. Any Reviewer Batch Job (RBJ) file can be executed against the NYSDOT ELRS using this tool.
tool.usage:
• If the specified reviewer workspace is not a Data Reviewer workspace, use the Enable Data Reviewer tool to create one.

  • You can create a session with the Create Reviewer Session tool. Create Reviewer Session generates a session ID and name as an output parameter. If executing from Workflow Manager, the Reviewer Session should be generated in the workflow prior to execution, and the username and Job ID must be passed as input parameters.

  • Reviewer Batch Jobs are created in Data Reviewer for Desktop

  • The Job Started Date refers to the date the version was created. This date will be used as the minimum date from which routes will be selected, using the EDITED_DATE field on the LRSN_Milepoint table

  • The RBJ results are written to the specified session, determined from the Job ID and Job Owned By input parameters.

  • The Production Workspace should be an SDE file that points to the ELRS database of interest

  • The Reviewer Workspace is the workspace where the Reviewer Batch Job results will be written

  • The Batch Job File is the Reviewer Batch Job (.rbj) file that has been constructed using ArcMap.

  • The Log Path will write processing information to a text file (.txt). This is the same information that is displayed in the Geoprocessing window.

idCitation.resTitle: Execute Reviewer Batch Job on R&H Edits

dataIdInfo.idAbs: Runs a Data Reviewer Batch Job (.rbj) file against a version of an enterprise geodatabase. Input parameters determine the date from which edits should be examined and the username of the editor whose edits should be examined. Any Reviewer Batch Job (RBJ) file can be executed against the NYSDOT ELRS using this tool.
